results.title: Box kite to swing wing
results.brief_description: A history of the Royal Australian Air Force from the original Australian Flying Corps to todays modern aircraft of Macchi jet trainers, medium range Hercules and Iriquois helicopters. Shows their operations in World Wars I and II, Korea, Malaya and Vietnam plus their peacetime operations.

results.title: Bowling action
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson and Denys Parsons
results.brief_description: An analysis of the slow-medium bowling action of Ray Smith of Essex. The movements of Smith’s body in a run-up and delivery are shown and analysed, using normal speed, slow motion, and suspended shots. At four key positions of the action, H.P. Crabtree illustrates a method by which boys can obtain concentrated practice in pitching the ball for both length and direction. Commentary by John Arlott and filmed on location at Lord’s (MCC), the home of cricket.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Realist Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids, Brian Smith, Dorothy Grayson and Denys Parsons

results.title: Bowlers (S)
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Benson and Hedges Overseas and Tripod Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Benson and Hedges golden greats of cricket”.
A comprehensive history of the game of cricket tracing the game’s development from the early nineteenth century to the present. This second part traces the careers of the world’s best bowlers including Frank Woolley, Richie Benaud, Prasanna Abdul Qadir, Frank Tyson, Jeff Thomson, Dennis Lillee, Imran Khan, Courtney Walsh and Curtly Ambrose. Includes footage from the world’s largest cricket and /or media libraries

results.title: Bowl Turning
results.brief_description: This video shows how to use gouges and flat tools, how to slow down the lathe to see exactly what happens when a tool cuts well, how to grind and sharpen the various turning tools and how to handle special challenges, like thin-wall, bark edge and end-grain bowls.

results.title: Bowie: the video collection
results.brief_description: A wonderful collection of the innovative and ever-evolving music by British rock singer/composer, David Bowie, spanning part of his amazing career from 1972 through to 1990. Includes rare video clips and appearances by Peter Frampton, Alan Freeman, Mick Jagger and many other internationally known rock music performers. Digitally re-mastered.

results.title: Bow bells
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Harlequin Productions and Anthony Simmons
results.brief_description: In “The London Spy”, Ned Ward’s delightful account of low life in the 18th Century, we are told how “the joyful alarm of Bow Bells call’d the weary apprentices from their work to unhitch their folded shutters and batten up their shops till next morning”. This is the atmosphere evoked by this film presenting faces, streets, buildings around the dock-yards of London’s East End. There is no commentary: the photographed scenes are accompanied by satirically matched snatches of music hall songs.

results.title: Bow and arrow
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew, Marrin Canell, Barrie Howells and William Pettigrew
results.brief_description: The bow and arrow has been described as a “royal instrument of sport” and a “lethal instrument of war”. This film presents a short history of a versatile tool and describes its functions through the ages: from the days of the great conqueror Genghis Khan who over ran China with this weapon, to the modern Olympics. (Award: American Film Festival)
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Desmond Dew, Marrin Canell, Barrie Howells and William Pettigrew

results.title: Bovine contagious pleuropneumonia
results.brief_description: This film traces the introduction and spread of the disease throughout Australia; why it persists in the north and how in spite of all precautions it occasionally infiltrates to the south. The main section of the film depicts in detail the characteristic symptoms and post-mortem findings, the effectiveness of vaccination, and the nature of present and past research work of the Division of Animal Health and Production.
